loans.name: Manzura

texts.ru: Манзура доброжелательная и активная женщина, она замужем и имеет детей. Живёт Манзура в сельском посёлке. Уже с юных лет она изучала рукоделие. И на сегодня она является настоящей  мастерицей  по рукоделию. Она занимается вышивкой национальной одежды. За свою деятельность она успела изучать все тонкости своего дела и воспитать ряд учеников. Манзура с самого начала своей деятельности привыкла выполнять заказ на высшем уровне. Супруг ее занимается строительством. Супруги живут счастливо и стараются воспитывать своих детей хорошими людьми. Старший сын учится в медицинском коллеже. Манзура и её муж от своей работы получают хороший доход, но его хватает только на пропитание. А сейчас Манзура хочет женить своего старшего сына, и занимается подготовкой свадебного приданного для молодожён. Ей необходимо закупить много дорогих вещей. Но у них имеется недостаточная сумма денег для этого. Поэтому Манзура обратилась в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку приданного для своего сына. Она заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Manzura is a friendly and active woman who is married and has children.  She lives in a village and from an early age, she has been involved in handicrafts.  Today she is a true master at work, making embroidered national costumes.  Her efforts have led her to learn all the intricacies of her work and to teach a number of apprentices.  From the moment she started her work, Manzura has made a habit of fulfilling orders to a very high quality.

Manzura's husband is a builder.  Their married life is happy and they are trying to raise their children to be good people.  Her eldest son is in medical school.  Manzura and her husband earn a decent living from their work, but it is only enough for their food.  Now their eldest son wants to get married and they are preparing a dowry for the couple.  Manzura needs to buy many expensive items, but they don't have enough money for everything.  This is why she has turned to Arvand - she wants to receive a loan to provide for her son's dowry.  She thanks Arvand in advance for their support.

loans.use: to buy a wedding dowry

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is 20 years old and is a single man who lives in Hodeidah, Yemen.

He has been operating a grocery store for more than one year where he sells basic products. He started his business with capital from his family. He is a very hardworking and kind person. He is happy about attracting new clients but on the other hand, the financial challenge of meeting customers' demands is hindering his business progress and growth. He said he needs to fill his store with more food products to serve his customers.

So he applied for a youth loan of 200,000 YER from AMB to buy more grocery products to sell.  In the future, he would like to expand his business so that he can increase his profit and get married.

loans.use: to buy more grocery products to sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria se dedica a la costura de prendas de vestir (chamarras y sacos), principalmente de tela y fibra.
Ella vive en casa propia, ubicada en El Alto en la zona Villa Ingenio. 
El sueño de Victoria es tener en un mediano plazo equipos y máquinas diseñadas para desarrollar altas velocidades y al mismo tiempo, obtener máxima eficiencia en los diferentes procesos de producción, lo que redunda en mayores volúmenes de fabricación, reducción en costos y mejora de la calidad de los productos. El crédito lo necesita ahora para la compra de una máquina industrial de coser. Asi, podrá brindar mejor servicio a sus clientes y mejorar la calidad de vida a su familia.

Es la primeraa vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en: Victoria works as a seamstress sewing clothing (jackets and bags) primarily made of fabric and thread. She lives in her own home located in El Alto in the Villa Ingenio zone. Victoria's dream is to have a small place with equipment and machines designed to sew at high speeds and, at the same time, to obtain maximum efficiency in the different production processes that would result in larger volumes of products, reduced costs and higher quality products. She currently needs this loan to purchase an industrial sewing machine. This way she will be able to provide better service to her clients and a better quality of life for her family. This is the first time that she is seeking a loan through IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase an industrial sewing machine that will bring increased efficiency to her business as a seamstress and jacket and bag designer for both sexes.

loans.name: Jarlin

texts.es: Don Jarlin es originario de la ciudad de Boaco, casado y padre de un hijo. De 33 años de edad. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la administración de un molino y venta de leña. Inicio su negocio con capital propio el cual le ayudo a comprar un pequeño molino con el cual comenzó a trabajar y poco a poco fue creciendo hasta el día de hoy. Su meta próxima es mejorar su situación económica y sacar adelante a su familia. Solicita el crédito para comprar un motor eléctrico, discos para su molino y darle mantenimiento a su molino actual. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda para ampliar su negocio y brindarles una mejor atención a sus clientes. Su plan futuro es establecer su negocio en el mercado popular de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Don Jarlin is from the city of Boaco. He is 33 years old, and he is married with one child. 

He is a businessman, running a mill and selling firewood.  He started his business with his own capital, which helped him to purchase a small mill.  He began working with it, and his business has been gradually growing to this day.  

His next goal is to improve his economic situation and keep his family going.  He is seeking a loan in order to purchase an electric motor and discs for his mill, and to perform maintenance on it.  He believes that the loan will be of great help in expanding his business and providing better service to his customers.  

His plan for the future is to establish his business in the city's popular market.

loans.use: to purchase an electric motor and discs for his mill, and to perform maintenance on it.

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en:
Fatu is 33 years old and lives in Kakata town; she is married and has four children who are attending school and live at home. 

Over the past two years, Fatu has been producing and selling iron soap (iron soap is made from caustic and palm oil). She makes lots of profit. The rainy season is the problem she faces. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more caustic and palm oil for her business. 

She plans to build a house for her children in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more caustic and palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Weedor

texts.en:
Weedor is 35 years old and lives in Kakata, the capital city of Margibi County, which is the highest-production rubber plantation in Liberia. 

She is single with two children, ages 10 and 21 years old. They live at home and are in school. 

For six years now, Weedor has been running a beauty salon in the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her father, and learned this trade from her friends. 

Weedor is requesting a loan to purchase more artificial hair, hair relaxer, etc. for her business. 

She hopes to build her house.

loans.use: to purchase more artificial hair, hair relaxer, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca lives in Kakata town, is married, and has three children, ages 3 to 12. They are in school and live at home. 

For the past five years, she has been selling roasted meat.  One of her main challenges she faces is the very high price of meat. She says her business helps her to send her children to school and bring food to the home.  

She is requesting a loan to purchase more meat, peppers, onions, etc. for her business. 

She plans to build her house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more meat, peppers, onions, etc for her business.

loans.name: Gawu

texts.en:
43-year-old Gawu lives in Kakata town. She is married and has three children between the ages of 2 and 12; all three of them are in school and live at home. 

Over the past 12 years, she has been involved in the sale of salt, pepper, onions, flour, oil, maggi cubes, etc. in the local market. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more salt, pepper, onions, flour, oil, maggi cubes, etc. for her business. 

She plans to build her house and expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more salt, pepper, onions, flour, oil, maggi cubes, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Teta

texts.en:
Teta, 41 years old, lives in Kakata, the capital city of Margibi County, which has the highest production of rubber plantations in Liberia. She is married and has four children between the ages of 18 and 25 years, one of whom lives at home and is in school. Teta, unfortunately, did not attend school.

Teta has been involved in her business for the past 15 years. Presently, she is selling nails, door locks, copy books, reading books, etc. in the local market. She started this business with 1,000 LRD given to her by her mother, from whom she learned this trade. Teta is requesting a loan to purchase more nails, door locks, copy books, reading books, etc. for her business. Her future plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more nails, door locks, copy books, reading books, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is single and has two children aged 7 and 3, who are in school and live at home. Ruth completed 8th grade before starting her business.  She describes herself as hardworking. 

Ruth has a table where she sells oil, flour, sugar, etc. in the local market.  She has been in this business for the past four years and works 9 hours each day. She transports her goods by shared taxi. She started her business with a loan from her mother. One of the greatest challenges that she faces is her small income. She is proud of her business because it provides her daily expenses.  

Ruth will use this loan to buy oil, flour and sugar to resell. Her plan is to build a house. Ruth thanks you in advance for your support!

loans.use: to buy oil, flour and sugar to resell.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
Mamie is 40 years old and lives in Kakata, the capital city of Margibi county, which has the highest production of rubber plantations in Liberia.  She is single with two children, ages 12 and 15. They live at home and attend school. 

She was unfortunate to attend school; she has been selling coal in the local market for the past six years.  She started this business with money given to her by her brother to help herself; she learned this way of selling from her friends. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more coal for her business. 

Her future plan is to educate all her children.

loans.use: to purchase more coal for her business.

loans.name: Dora

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! Dora, in her late thirties, is from Magburaka, Makeni Northern area. She is married and has 6 children.  She was a housewife; she started this business to help her husband take care of the home. 

Dora runs a general stock business, selling a variety of rice, soft drinks and pure water. She has been running this business for 8 years, working 11 hours per day and 6 days per week. Dora says that, at present, her business is doing well.

Dora has requested a loan in order to buy more varieties of rice, soft drinks and pure water for resale.  The extra income from this loan will allow her to become a successful businesswoman and to change her status of living. In the future, Dora plans to expand her business more than ever. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more varieties of rice, soft drinks and pure water for resale.

loans.name: Suliaman

texts.en:
Meet Suliaman. He is in his late forties, and from Magburaka northern area in Freetown. He is married with four children between the ages of 9 and 20 years. Three of his children are currently attending school. 

In 2010, Suliaman established his clothing business. He began his business because after completing his secondary school, his father could not pay for his collage, so he decided to run a business. He works at the business from 7:00 am until 7:00 pm, 6 days per week. He says that the main challenge to his business is the high cost of transportation.

Suliaman requires a loan to buy more shoes, jeans and clothing material to sell. 

He hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow him to pay his children school fees and increase his business. 

In the future, Suliaman plans to build a permanent business place. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more shoes, jeans and clothing material to sell.

loans.name: Sanga

texts.en:
Sanga is 28 years old and lives in Kakata, the capital city of Margibi county, which is has the highest production of rubber plantations in Liberia.  She is married, with a 4-year-old child living at home and attending school. 

Sanga completed 12th grade before starting her business. She has been selling red oil, pepper, rice, etc in the local market for the past eight years now.  She started this business when she thought of being able to do something for herself.  She learned this trade from friends. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more red oil, pepper, rice, etc. for her business. 

Her future plan is to educate her child.

loans.use: to purchase more red oil, pepper, rice, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is involved in selling frozen fish, meat, and chicken in Likpe Bala (near Hohoe). Her earnings are generally used to help her husband (who is a petty trader and farmer) support their three children. 

She has been involved in selling frozen fish, meat, chicken, and smoked fish for two years now. She plans on using her loan to purchase additional cartons of frozen fish, meat, chicken, and smoked fish, thus helping her sell more due to increased inventory capacity. 

She aspires to use her profits to both better market her smoked fish enterprise and increase her existing working capital. She hopes that this strategy will allow her to expand her present customer base.

loans.use: to purchase additional cartons of frozen fish, meat, chicken, and smoked fish to sell.

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en: Mabel is a food vendor who is involved in preparing and selling Fufu a local Ghanaian dish. Fufu is a thick paste made from boiled cassava and unripe plantains beaten together until the desired consistency is reached. It is usually taken with light soup, palm-nut or groundnut soup and the product is sold in Likpe Bala (near Hohoe). Her earnings are generally used to help her husband (who is a farmer) support their three children. She has been involved in this business for close to seven years now. She plans on using her loan to purchase additional amounts of cassava, yams, chicken cartons, meat and fish, and palm fruits, helping her sell more due to increased inventory capacity. She aspires to use her profits to both better market her Fufu business and increase her existing working capital. She hopes that this strategy will allow her to expand her present customer base.

loans.use: to purchase additional amounts of cassava, yam, chicken cartons, meat and fish, and palm fruits.

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en: Bridget is involved in hairdressing in Likpe Bala (near Hohoe). Her earnings are generally used to help her husband (who is a chainsaw operator) support their five children. She has been involved in hairdressing and other petty trading business for 12 years now. She plans on using her loan to purchase additional amounts of hair extension products, hair relaxers and body lotion and pomade.  This will help her sell more due to increased inventory capacity. She aspires to use her profits to both better market her cosmetic enterprise and increase her existing working capital. She hopes that this strategy will allow her to expand her present customer base.

loans.use: to purchase additional amounts of hair extension products, hair relaxers and body lotion and pomade.

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.en: Even though Benedicta grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. Currently, Benedicta is an entrepreneur. She sells sandals, food containers, rubber containers and baskets, and any other petty trading activity that the season may bring in Likpe Bala (near Hohoe). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began five years ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their four children. Benedicta has identified that there are growing demands among consumers for her product. Nevertheless, she is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory. She plans to use her loan to purchase more sandals and introduce the sale of children's sandals, rubber bowls and cups to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Benedicta wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more sandals and introduce the sale of children's sandals, rubber bowls and cups to sell.

loans.name: Aurora Pastora

texts.es:
En la parroquia Quiroga de la  ciudad de Calceta, localidad donde la gente se dedica en gran parte a la agricultura, cría de animales  y a la venta de sus productos, se reúne cada quince días el Grupo De Crédito Quiroga.
En este lugar vive la señora Aurora, tiene 48 años está casada y de esta relación tuvo 5 hijos, pero uno de ellos falleció  hace algunos años,  tres de ellos son mayores de edad, el menor tiene 14 años y estudia en colegio y es el que aun vive en su casa ya que los otros ya son independientes. Su  esposo es comerciante.
Doña Aurora junto a su esposo se dedican a diversas actividades con la finalidad que en su hogar no falte nada, mientras ella se dedica a la cría de pollos y chanchos él se dedica a la agricultura y a la compra y venta de frutas. El  recorre los campos recogiendo los productos de la zona, compra naranjas, mandarinas, limón, sandias, melón, etc. Y las lleva a entregar a Portoviejo, aunque también una vez por semana envían estos productos a la ciudad de Quito ya que allá los venden a mejor precio, mientras el realiza esta actividad ella se dedica a la cría de sus animalitos los mismos que entrega a comerciantes cuando están para la venta, es así como ellos luchan incansablemente día a día para salir adelante. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar frutas así como también alimento para los pollos y los chanchos. Lleva más de 9 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda. Sus sueños son tener un camión para que su marido lleve sus productos.
texts.en:
In the parish of Quiroga within the city of Calceta, there is a town where the people spend most of their time farming, raising animals, and selling their products. The Communal Bank "Quiroga" meets here every 15 days.

It is also in this place where Sra. Aurora lives. She is 48 years old, married, and has five children but one of them has been deceased for a few years. Three of her children are adults and her youngest one is 14 years old, is in school, and lives at home. The other children are already independent. Her husband is a merchant.

Doña Aurora and her husband engage in different business activities so that they can provide everything they need for their household. While she spends time raising chickens and pigs, her husband is busy farming and buying and selling fruit. He travels to farms in order to buy local products such as oranges, tangerines, lemons, watermelons, melons, and other fruit. Her husband delivers the fruit to Portoviejo, but he also ships these products once a week to the city of Quito where he is able to sell them at a better price. In the meantime, Aurora raises her animals and delivers them to the merchants when they are ready to be sold. Both of them work tirelessly day after day so that they can get ahead.

This loan will be used to buy fruits and also feed for her chickens and pigs. Aurora has been with her Communal Bank for more than nine years and enjoys the assistance she has received. Her dreams include having a truck so that her husband can deliver his products.

loans.use: to buy fruits for her husband's business and also animal feed for her chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Garnik

texts.en:
Garnik is a married man with two daughters and a son. He lives in Kapan city, which is in the Syunik region of Armenia. Garnik has a vocational education, and for several years worked as a locksmith.

Since 2005, he has operated his own business. First, he worked out of a rented space, where he installed a portable booth to sell fruits and vegetables. Up until 2011 he worked in that booth, but thanks to his hard work and efforts, he managed to save money and to build a small shop, where he currently operates his business. Garnik managed to buy a truck, on which he transports fruits and vegetables, and which has also greatly reduced his expanses. He sells great a variety of fruits and vegetables, such as: apples, mandarins, oranges, grapes, kiwis, potatoes, onions, garlic, beetroot, and cabbage.

Garnik says that, in order to generate good income, he always chooses fresh, pure and not very expensive produce for his stall. He is asking for a loan in the amount of 1,100,000 AMD in order to buy a large batch of fruits and vegetables for re-sale purpose.

loans.use: to purchase a large batch of fruits and vegetables for re-sale

loans.name: Célestine's Group

texts.fr: C'est un groupe constitué de trois personnes dont la représentante (dont la main est levée sur la photo) se nomme  Célestine. Les membres du groupe vivent dans le même quartier. Ce groupe sollicite un premier crédit en vue de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d'augmenter leur chiffre d'affaire. Âgée de 30 ans, Célestine est mariée à un certain Karim et est mère de deux enfants. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés et vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Le couple subvient ensemble aux besoins du ménage. Pour y arriver, Célestine vend depuis cinq ans, des liqueurs, de l'akassa (aliment local à base d'amidon de maïs) et des poissons à son domicile. Célestine s’approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. Célestine sollicite un financement auprès de ALIDé, afin d'agrandir son activité et d'accroître son chiffre d'affaire et son revenu.
texts.en: This group comprises three people, and its leader (whose hand is raised in the photo) is named Célestine. The group members live in the same area. This group is seeking its first loan with the goal of raising the level of their businesses and increasing their sales. Célestine is 30 years old, married to a man named Karim, and has two children. Both the children are in school and live together with their parents. The couple take care of the household needs together. In order to achieve this, Célestine has sold liquor, akassa (a local food made of corn starch), and fish at her home for the past five years. Célestine gets her supplies in an area of Benin. She is seeking a loan with ALIDÉ in order to expand her business and increase her sales and income.

loans.use: To buy and sell liquor.

loans.name: Sélimath's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Sélimath est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Sélimath est âgée de 30 ans et est mariée à un certain Idriss. Le couple a un enfant, scolarisé, et à sa charge. Sélimath vit avec son enfant. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Sélimath mène comme activité, la vente de bouillie de maïs et aussi des divers (bombons, etc.) de façon ambulante. Sélimath s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but d’augmenter le stock de ses produits et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Sélimath désire obtenir un crédit avec les autres membres de son groupe.
texts.en: This group comprises three people who live in the same area. The group leader is named Sélimath and has her hand raised in the photo. This is the first time this group is seeking financial support from ALIDÉ with the goal of raising the level of their businesses. Sélimath is 30 years old and married to a man named Idriss. The couple have one child who attends school and is in their care. Sélimath lives with her child. To meet the various household expenses, Sélimath runs a business selling maize "bouillie" (a type of porridge) and also various items (sweets, etc.) door-to-door. She gets her supplies at a market in Benin. With the goal of increasing her stock of products and better responding to her customers' demands, Sélimath would like to obtain a loan with the other members of her group.

loans.use: To buy maize, sugar, and sweets.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: After graduating junior high school, Sarah went to learn how to sew and now she has set up her own sewing center in Likpe Bala (near Hohoe).  With over three years worth of experience, she is currently looking to expand her business further. Unfortunately, she is limited due to a lack of funding. As a result, this loan will be used to help her purchase different colors of sewing thread, zippers, linen and pins. She aims to use the profits from her business to help support her husband (who is a peasant farmer) with the upkeep of their house whilst ensuring that their two children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to purchase different colors of sewing thread, zippers, linen and pins.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is single and owns a hardware store. He has been dealing house construction materials for the past two years.

He has requested a loan to buy more iron sheets and cement for re-sale purposes. He would like to save any of the profits he generates from the business as a result of the loan. He was very happy after he successfully repaid his previous loan.

loans.use: to purchase additional construction materials (e.g., iron sheets and cement) for re-sale.

loans.name: Dorcas Group

texts.en:
Josephine is the chairperson of the Dorcas Group. Josephine is a married woman with three children, two of whom go to school.

To earn a living, she works as a cross-border trader, who travels back and forth between Botswana and South Africa to buy and sell electrical goods. She has been operating this business for more than three years. She operates a shop in Mutare, and the other group members are in the same business.

She is requesting this loan to buy more electrical goods, such as radios, television sets, speakers, and DVDs for re-sale purposes.

loans.use: to purchase additional electrical goods (e.g., radios, televisions, speakers, and DVDs) for re-sale.

loans.name: Nowai

texts.en: Nowai is 44 years old and unmarried.  She has 5 children between 15 and 25, who are in school and live at home with her. For the past 5 years, she has been selling rice, oil, onion, pepper, etc. from a shop. She established the business with loan from her fiance. She encounters a few problems in her business because sometimes her customers do not have enough money, and sometimes they buy on credit.  She enjoys it when customers pay quickly for their purchases. She is asking for a loan to buy more of the same inventory for her business. She plans to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more rice, oil, onion, pepper, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Ramata

texts.en:
Meet Ramatu; she is in her late forties, from Magburaka, Makeni Northern area in Sierra Leone.  She is married with four children.  For the past ten years, Ramatu has established her retail business.  She began her business, because she wants to create a means of survival.  She works at the business 11 hours per day and seven days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and transportation problems.

Ramatu requires a loan in order to purchase bags of rice, cartons of cigarettes, drinks, and soap to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and to increase her business. In the future, Ramatu plans to expand her business more than ever. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice, cartons of cigarettes, drinks, and soap to expand her business.

loans.name: Oretha

texts.en:
Oretha, 43 years old, lives in Kakata, the capital city of Margibi County, which is the highest producing rubber plantation in Liberia. She is married and has seven children aged between 11 and 24, all attending school and living at home. 

For the past three years, Oretha has been operating her business at a table in the local market, where she sells dried fish. Sometimes she has fewer customers, but most of the time she makes a lot of profit. Oretha spends nine hours at her business and she uses taxis to get her goods to her table in the market. Oretha is applying for a loan to buy more dried fish for her business. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish for her business.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is 39 years old and lives in Kakata, the capital city of Margibi county, which has the highest production of rubber plantations in Liberia.  

She is married with six children between the ages of 1 to 18; all of them live at home and five attend school. She was able to completed 12th grade before starting business. She has been selling beer, stout, and soft drinks for the past four years. She started this business with money from her mother, and learned this trade from friends. 

Julie is requesting a loan to purchase more beer, stout, and soft drinks for her business. 

Her future plan is to educate all her children.

loans.use: to purchase more beer, stout, and soft drinks for her business.

loans.name: Saih

texts.en:
Saih is 20 years old and lives in Kakata, the capital city of Margibi county, which has the highest production of rubber plantations in Liberia. She is single, with a three-year-old child who lives at home and is in school. She stopped her education at eight grade.  

She has been selling red oil in the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her friends, and learned this trade from them. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more red oil for her business. 

Her future plans are to educate her child and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more red oil for her business.

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en:
Fatu is 49 years old and lives in Kakata, the capital city of Margibi county, which has the highest production of rubber plantations in Liberia. She is married with three children between the ages of 19 and 30.  Only two are in school and live at home. 

Fatu was unable to attend school, so she joined into business. For six years now, she has been selling local red oil, pepper, Vita, etc. in the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her husband, and learned this trade from her friends. She spends eight hours a day, six days a week on her business.  She mostly used a taxi to get her goods at her market.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more red oil, pepper, Vita, etc. for her business. 

She hopes to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more red oil, pepper, Vita, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Se Bo Gnan Group

texts.fr: Le groupe SE BO GNAN est composé de trois personnes qui vivent toutes dans le même quartier. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Adèle est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Adèle est âgée de 33 ans. Adèle est mariée à un certain Antoine et a deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Adèle et son mari assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la famille. Adèle vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Afin de se prendre en charge et d'améliorer son niveau de vie, Adèle exerce depuis dix ans environs, comme activité la vente de chaussures, de sacs et des bijoux par le système de distribution. Adèle achète ses produits au Togo. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son revenu, Adèle sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe SE BO GNAN, un deuxième crédit.
texts.en: The "Se Bo Gnan" group comprises three people who all live in the same area. This is the second time this group is seeking financial support from ALIDÉ with the goal of raising the level of their businesses. The group leader is named Adèle and has her hand raised in the photo. Adèle is 33 years old. She is married to a man named Antoine and has two children, both in school. Adèle and her husband take care of the various household expenses together. Adèle lives together with her husband and children. In order to take care of herself and improve her living conditions, Adèle has run a business selling shoes, bags, and jewelry through the distribution system for about ten years. She buys her products in Togo. With the goal of satisfying her clientele and increasing her income, she is seeking a second loan together with the other members of the Se Bo Gnan group.

loans.use: To buy shoes and bags

loans.name: Martine's Group

texts.fr: C'est un groupe constitué de trois personnes et dont la représentante (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est nommée Martine. Les membres du groupe se connaissent compte tenu du fait qu’ils habitent le même quartier. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupe sollicite pour la deuxième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Âgée de 33 ans, Martine est une veuve et mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Martine vit avec ses enfants et assure leurs différents besoins grâce au revenu de son activité. Martine n’a jamais fréquenté l’école. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Martine mène comme activité, la vente de charbon de bois à son domicile. Martine s'approvisionne auprès des grossistes. Martine a déjà sept ans d’expérience dans l’exercice de cette activité. Ce prêt permettra certainement à Martine et à son groupe de rehausser le niveau de leur activité par l’augmentation du stock de leurs produits et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en: This group comprises three people and its leader (whose hand is raised in the photo) is named Martine. The group members know each other from living in the same area. With the goal of increasing their working capital, this group is seeking a loan with ALIDÉ for the second time. Martine is 33 years old and a widowed mother of three children, all in school. She lives with her children and provides for their various needs thanks to the income from her business. Martine never attended school. To provide for herself, Martine runs a business selling charcoal at her home. She gets her supplies from wholesalers. She already has seven years of experience running this business. This loan will certainly allow Martine and her group to raise the level of their businesses by expanding their stock of products and increasing their clientele and income.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.en: Due to difficult circumstances, Benedicta did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Benedicta sells foodstuffs like yams, cassava and also sells smoked fish, fresh tomatoes and peppers in Likpe Bala (near Hohoe). She has been doing so for about 15 years. She is married to a driver, and together they have 6 children. Benedicta uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. Benedicta will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of smoked fish, fresh eggs, a carton of canned tomatoes and various foodstuffs, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Benedicta wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase smoked fish, fresh eggs, canned tomatoes and various foodstuffs

loans.name: Dora

texts.en: Dora sells cooking utensils and rubber containers in Likpe Bala (near Hohoe). She has had some form of formal education as she is a middle school graduate. She is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a farmer. Dora has been working as a petty trader selling utensils and rubber containers for close to 15 years. Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. She plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of cooking pots, frying pans, sauce pans, and laundry baskets, thus allowing her to meet rising customer demand. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to develop her business further and ensure that all her children receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of cooking pots, frying pans, sauce pans, and laundry baskets

loans.name: Gertrude

texts.en: Due to difficult circumstances, Gertrude did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Gertrude sells foodstuffs like bananas, plantains, yams, and also palm (red) oil in Likpe Bala (near Hohoe). She has been doing so for about 20 years. As a widow with 5 children, Gertrude uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. Gertrude will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of bananas, plantains and yams, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Gertrude wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education and also reinvest some into her palm oil business since there is market for it currently.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of bananas, plantains and yams

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en: Elsa works hard to support her family. Elsa is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional materials for her tailoring business. Elsa has been in this business for 10 years now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en: Nilda is 59 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc. Nilda has been in this business for 8 years.  She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Amada

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of four children, Amada works hard to support her family. She has a wholesale soft drinks business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising chickens.  Amada is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more stocks of soft drinks to sell for her wholesale soft drinks business.

Amada has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Erlida

texts.en: Erlida is 58 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them. Erlida runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like soap, milk, chips, eggs, bread, etc. She has been in this business for 19 years. Erlida would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like soap, milk, chips, eggs, bread, etc.

loans.name: Virgenia

texts.en: Virgenia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. Virgenia requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like soap, shampoo, milk, soft drinks, canned goods, etc. to sell. She has been in this business for 8 years now. In the future, Virgenia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like soap, shampoo, milk, soft drinks, canned goods, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Virgie works hard to support her family. Virgie is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, soap and shampoo. Virgie has been in this business for 6 years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, soap and shampoo to sell

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a pig raising business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Concepcion has been in this business for many years. Concepcion earns more income from cattle breeding. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now has requested a new loan to further build her business.

Concepcion has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Crispina

texts.en:
Crispina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a banana business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional bananas to sell.

Crispina has been in this business for 10 years. Crispina earns more income from a general store that she operates.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Crispina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to build a house for her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional bananas to sell

loans.name: Vahagn

texts.en:
Vahagn is a 41-year-old father of six children (four daughters and two sons). His oldest daughter is a student, while his other children are nearly school-age.

He has a vocational education and a specialty in mechanics, but he then developed skills as a tailor. For five years he worked as a shoemaker, but in recent years he became engaged in farming and agriculture activities.

On his farm he has four cows, four bulls, four calves, and 21 piglets; he also has a tractor and a combine of his own. He sells his farm outputs and receives good profits from his sales. This year he managed to gather a lot of hay for his cattle, which ought to be more than enough for the winter months.

Vahagn is asking for a loan in the amount of 700,000 AMD in order to buy two more cows and to increase both his farm cattle and his family income.

loans.use: to expand his farming operations by purchasing two additional cows

loans.name: Leila

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Leila works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport.  Leila is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients to produce food for her food vending business.

Leila has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for food production.

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.ru: Гулмире 36 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Гулмиры -среднее образование. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Гулмира занимается полеводством, а точнее выращиванием овощей, стартовав 16 лет назад, с 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Гулмиры, на сегодняшний день у нее имеется: 0,24 ГА земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает ранние огурцы, репчатый лук и помидоры для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Полеводством занимается практически одна, так как супруг -частный строитель, подрабатывает на стройках в сезонное время, а внесезонное время помогает Гулмире на поле. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гулмира обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку семян огурцов, помидоров, а также удобрений и ядохимикатов. Доходы от кредита Гулмира планирует вложить улучшение финансового состояния семьи, что способствует улучшению жилищных условий. В будущем Гульмира с супругом намерены построить теплицу во дворе дома.
texts.en:
Gulmira is 36 years old and married.  She and her husband are raising two children.  She has a secondary education and is involved in agriculture, an activity which constitutes her family's main source of income.  She essentially grows vegetables, which she started doing 16 years ago with an initial capital of 5,000 som.  Thanks to Gulmira's hard work, her farm now consists of 0.24 hectares of land and she cultivates early cucumbers, onions and potatoes on a yearly basis, for the family's consumption as well as for resale.

Gulmira takes care of her farm practically by herself.  Her husband is a private builder who works on construction sites during the building season and helps his wife with the farm-work during the off-season.  Gulmira makes a monthly income of 10,000 som (KGS).  In order to further develop her farming business, she has turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" and requested a loan to buy cucumber and tomato seeds, as well as fertilizers and pesticides.  With the earnings from her loan Gulmira plans to improve her family's financial situation and, ultimately, their living conditions.  In the future, she and her husband would like to build a greenhouse on their property.

loans.use: to buy cucumber and tomato seeds, as well as fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Zafar

texts.ru: Зафар 28-летний фермер. Он живет с женой, двумя детьми и родителями в районе Шахритус. У него высшее образование. Он бухгалтер и работает по своей профессии. Одновременно Зафар в течение 10 лет занимается растениеводством. Он имеет орошаемый участок земли, на котором выращивает сельскохозяйственные культуры. Зафар занимается земледелием всей семьей. В данный момент он просит кредит, чтобы купить качественные семена картофеля и минеральные удобрения. Данный кредит поможет ему провести посевные работы и к весне получить хороший урожай. Зафар надеется на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Zafar is a 28-year-old farmer who lives with his wife, his two children and his parents in the Shahrituz district of Tajikistan.  He has a higher education and works as an accountant.  For the past ten years, he has also been involved in agriculture.  He owns an irrigated plot of land on which he grows crops.  The whole family helps him with the business.  He is taking a loan to buy high quality potato seeds as well as mineral fertilizers.  With this loan, he will be able to start sowing his land, and in the spring, get a good harvest.  Zafar is awaiting your support.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es:
Ana es una señora de 30 años, es madre soltera y vive en Sololá. Ella tiene dos hijos un varón de 10 años y una nena de 8 años, ellos están estudiando. Ella se dedica a la venta de frutas preparadas, que son colocadas en bandejas y de esta forma sale a ofrecer en las oficinas, tiendas, juzgados etc. Ella empezó este pequeño negocio por la necesidad de mantener a sus hijos a raíz de la separación con su pareja. 
Ella lucha por el bienestar de sus hijos y de esta manera salir adelante también como mujer. Ella solicita un préstamo de Q 3,000.00 para capital de trabajo y así ampliar su negocio de frutas, mejorando su ingreso y el servicio a sus clientes. Su sueño es construir una casa propia para ella y sus hijos ya que por el momento están alquilando la casa donde viven.
texts.en:
Ana is a 30-year-old woman, single mother, and lives in Sololá. She has two children: a 10-year-old boy and an 8-year-old girl. They both are in school. She makes a living selling fruit, which she places on trays, allowing her to sell the fruit in offices, shops, and courthouses. She started this small business due to the need to support her children since separating with her partner.

She works hard for the well-being of her children, as well as to get ahead as a woman. She is requesting a loan of 3,000 quetzals for working capital. This will allow her to grow her fruit business, thus increasing her income and improving customer service. Her dream is to build a house for her and her children, since at the moment, they are renting the house where they live.

loans.use: to expand her fruit business.

loans.name: Honorata

texts.es:
Honorata tiene 53 años de edad y tiene tres hijos, ella se dedica a la atención de su tienda de abarrotes donde expende sus productos como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos y otros cosas más, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería  panetones, chocolates y otras cosas más. 

Honorata está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Honorata is 53 years old and has three children. She manages a grocery store where she offers products such as rice, sugar, noodles, and other items. Honorata is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to buy merchandise such as panettones, chocolates, and other products.

She is pleased with the loan that has been granted and promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy panettones, chocolates, and other products.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado  Kuña Guapa está formado por 25 integrantes, quienes están en el ciclo número 10  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se pusieron como objetivo poder ayudarse las unas a las otras, y por medio de ese trabajo también poder ayudar a sus familias. También forman parte del programa de eliminación de pobreza, para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Ramona, quien en la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza que hizo estaba en el nivel 1, es decir con ingresos bajos, pero está consciente que a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y las aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, ella se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza. Entre el trabajo que ella hace comenta que se dedica a hacer muchas cosas, como ser la venta de productos de limpieza, venta de comidas  y compra venta de cualquier producto de mercería.
La Sra. Solicita este crédito para la compra de productos de mercería, como ser prendas, calzados, etc., que le permitirá seguir creciendo y mejorando cada día en su negocio, a la vez que crecer como microemprendedora.
texts.en:
This group is called Kuña Guapa and is made up of 25 members in their 10th cycle in the committee for women program, where they all work to help one another and their families.  The also form part of the elimination of poverty program in order to improve their life conditions.

Ramona is one of the members who’s survey results showed her to be at level 1, that is to say of low income, but she knows that she is bettering her poverty situation through her work and continued application of the behaviors of a successful woman.  She says that she does many things such as selling cleaning products, food, and buying and selling general merchandise. 

She is asking for a loan to buy merchandise such as clothing, shoes, etc. that will allow her to continue growing and improving her business every day and grow as an entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Santa Catalina Group

texts.es:
El grupo Santa Catalina se formó en Ciudad del Este, donde estas mujeres forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, el cual les permitirá poder conocer la situación de cada una, y conforme a eso poder seguir creciendo y mejorando su calidad de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra.  Juliana, quien en su encuesta de eliminación mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, es decir con ingresos muy bajos, y que debe seguir esforzándose por crecer y mejorar.  Ella a través de la venta de golosinas y empanadas en una cantina de la una escuela está tratando y luchando por mejorar sus ingresos y sus condiciones de vida. Es una persona que se destaca por el gran entusiasmo que tiene, ya que quiere seguir creciendo como persona y profesional.
Pide de este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de golosinas varias, como así también de insumos para sus empanadas, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas.
texts.en:
The Santa Catalina group is made up of these women who form part of the elimination of poverty program, which allows them to know one another’s situations and in this way continue growing and improving their qualities of life.

Juliana is one of the members in the program and showed a level one poverty level that is of very low income and she knows that she must continue to grow and improve herself.  Through her sale of snacks and empanadas at a school canteen, she is working to improve her income and quality of life.  She is a person characterized by her great enthusiasm and who wants to continue growing as a person and as a professional.

She is asking for this loan to buy snacks and empanada making ingredients.  In this way she can continue making sales.

loans.use: to buy snacks and ingredients.

loans.name: Daysi

texts.es:
Daysi es una chica que se esmera, ya que está trabajando y estudiando, ya que sabe que es la única forma de poder crecer y salir adelante.
Está estudiando para ser profesora de didáctica universitaria, ya que quiere poder enseñar a las personas que al igual que ella quieren poder aprender.
Pide este crédito para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus clases y también de sus cuotas, ya que de esa forma podrá seguir superándose y cumplir su meta.
texts.en:
Daysi is a young lady who works with care and is working and going to school because she knows that this is the only way to get ahead.

She is studying to be a university-level didactics professor because she wants to be able to teach people that they can lean.

She is asking for this loan to be able to pay for her courses and tuition.  In this way she can continue to succeed and meet her goals.

loans.use: to pay tuition.

loans.name: Eleonor

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Eleonor works hard to support her family.

She has a general store in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling dried fish and raising pigs. Eleonor is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, canned goods and eggs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requests a new loan to further build her business.

Eleonor has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, canned goods and eggs

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Helen works hard to support her family.

To earn a living, she operates a general store business in the Philippines. She earns additional income by raising pigs.

Helen is seeking to borrow a loan in the amount of 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more items to sell, such as noodles, coffee, milk, and chips for her general store business. She proudly states that she successfully repaid her previous loans and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Helen has been sustaining her business activities through ten previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory (e.g., noodles, coffee, milk, and chips) for re-sale

loans.name: Josita

texts.en:
Josita works hard to support her family. Josita is married and raises pigs in the Philippines to earn a living.

Josita is requesting a loan in the amount of 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Josita has been in this business for 10 years. She explains that she successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. In the future, Josita would like to save enough money so that she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to further expand her business by purchasing additional feed and vitamins for her pig-raising business

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Lucy works hard to support her family.

To earn a living, she buys and sells fish in the Philippines. She earns additional income from food vending.

Lucy is seeking to borrow a loan in the amount of 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell for her business. She explains that she successfully paid back her previous loans and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Lucy has been sustaining her business activities through 11 prior loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to further expand her business by purchasing additional fish for re-sale

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. Merly has been in this business for 24 years. She earns additional income by providing motorcycle transportation services.

She is seeking to borrow a loan in the amount of 18,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional items such as sugar, soap, shampoo, and canned goods for her general store business. She explains that she successfully paid back her previous loans and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Merly has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to further expand her business by purchasing additional items (e.g., sugar, soap, shampoo, and canned goods) for re-sale

loans.name: Leah Ann

texts.en:
Leah Ann is 19 years old and has two children who are in school. She is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Leah Ann requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Leah Ann has been pig fattening for 2 years now, and has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 38 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 9,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like biscuits, sugar, soft drinks, etc. to sell.

Marivic has borrowed and paid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane and buying and selling rice. Marivic aspires to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like biscuits, sugar, soft drinks, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane works hard to support her family. She has a business, selling ready-to-wear clothing, in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 16 years.

Mary Jane requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional stock to sell, like t-shirts, shorts, and pants.

She is a widow and has children. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell, like t-shirts, shorts, and pants.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 55 years old and married. She has three children. Mercy works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business, selling nipa roofing in the Philippines. She has been running the nipa roofing business for 33 years, and she earns additional income from a general store.

She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional stock (nipa) to sell.

Mercy has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF, before this loan. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional nipa roofing to sell.

loans.name: Merlie

texts.en:
Merlie is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for one year, and she earns additional income by selling rice, at retail.

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF. She will use it to purchase additional stock to sell at her general store, like soy sauce, biscuits, juice, canned goods, milk, and sugar.

Merlie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money, to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell, like soy sauce, biscuits, and juice

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is 59 years old and married with nine children.

Nena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks like shampoo, soap, sugar, etc. to resell. Nena has borrowed and paid back 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 38 years and also earns an income from direct selling Avon products.

Nena aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks like shampoo, soap, sugar, etc. to resell.

loans.name: Elnura

texts.ru: Эльнуре 32 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Эльнуры - средне-специальное образование, домохозяйка занимается воспитанием детей и домашним хозяйством. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Эльнура занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 12 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. На сегодняшний день у Эльнуры имеется: 1,14 ГА земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает клевер, фасоль и кукурузу для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет 16,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жаркынай обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку семян фасоли, а также селитру и удобрения. Доходы от кредита Эльнура планирует вложить на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Elnura is 32 years old and married. She and her husband are raising three children. She has a specialized secondary education and is now a homemaker, raising her children and taking care of the house.  She is also involved in agriculture and animal husbandry, an activity which constitutes her family's main source of income.  She started in this field 12 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 5,000 som (KGS).  She now owns 1.14 hectare of land on which she grows clover, beans and maize annually for the family's consumption as well as for resale.

Elnura makes a monthly income of 16,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her farming business, she has turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" and requested a loan to buy bean seeds as well as fertilizers and ammonium nitrate. She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy bean seeds, fertilizers and ammonium nitrate.

loans.name: San Antonio Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Antonio es de la Ciudad de Villa Elisa, donde todas las integrantes forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde todas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, como un medio de poder ir mejorando y creciendo.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Julia, quien es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedor, ella es ama de casa y está trabajando también en la producción y venta de Productos de Limpieza se debe primeramente que ella siempre está muy atenta en las capacitaciones y tiene todo el entusiasmo de crecer.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de insumos para poder seguir haciendo sus productos de limpieza, lo que le ayudará a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group called "San Antonio" is from the city of Villa Elisa. All of the members are part of the poverty elimination program and have taken the poverty elimination survey. This will enable them to improve and grow.

One of the members is Sra. Julia, who is a hardworking and enterprising person. She is a housewife, but she also works by making and selling cleaning products. Most of all, Julia has always been very attentive during the training sessions and is enthusiastic about growing.

She is requesting a loan so that she can buy supplies that will allow her to continue making cleaning products. This will help to solidify her business plan, which will result in an improvement in her earnings.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making cleaning products.

loans.name: Yeth

texts.en: Yeth is 51 years old. She is married and resides with her two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling fish and vegetables for more than five years, earning approximately 5 USD per day. Her husband is a rice farmer who makes an income of 4 USD daily. One of her children is employed in a casino and earns about 5 USD each day. Due to lack of funding, Yeth is requesting a loan of 500 USD to purchase fertilizer and rice seeds for cultivation. In the future, she would like to run an additional business of breeding poultry and help her youngest child earn a higher education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and rice seeds for cultivation.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 38 years old and married with five children.

Fe works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like sugar, soy sauce, spices, milk, etc.

Fe has borrowed and paid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 9 years and also earns an income from selling fruit. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now request a new loan to further build her business. Fe aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like sugar, soy sauce, spices, milk, etc

loans.name: Sourouchi Toto's Group

texts.fr: C'est un groupe constitué de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier et dont la représentante (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) se nomme Sourouchi Toto. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupe sollicite pour la première fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Sourouchi Toto est âgée de 25 ans et est mariée à un certain Donatien. Le couple a cinq enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Sourouchi Toto vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure avec son mari les charges de la maison. Sourouchi Toto a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Pour satisfaire ses besoins et ceux de sa famille, Sourouchi Toto vend des beignets de haricot et de l'igname frit dans sa région depuis près de dix ans. Sourouchi Toto s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Ce prêt permettra certainement à  Sourouchi Toto et à son groupe de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en:
This is a group made up of three people who live in the same neighborhood and whose leader (the one who is raising her hand in the photo) is named Sourouchi Toto. With the goal of increasing their working capital, this group is seeking a loan from ALIDé for the first time.

Sourouchi Toto is 25 years old and is married to a man named Donatien. The couple has five children, all of whom attend school and are in their care. Sourouchi Toto lives with her children and her husband and, with her husband, sees to the household expenses. Sourouchi Toto stopped attending school in elementary school. In order to meet her needs and those of her family, Sourouchi Toto has been selling bean fritters and fried yam in her area for nearly 10 years. She gets her supplies at a market in Benin.

This loan will without doubt allow Sourouchi Toto and her group to increase their business and their income, and to expand their customer base.

loans.use: To purchase yams, vegetable oil, and charcoal.

loans.name: Rosaline's Group

texts.fr: C'est un groupe constitué de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier et dont la représentante (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) se nomme Rosaline. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupe sollicite pour la première fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Rosaline est âgée de 35 ans et est mariée à un certain Maxime. Le couple a cinq enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Rosaline n'a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour satisfaire ses besoins et ceux de sa famille, Rosaline vend des liqueurs et du charbon de bois. Rosaline s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Pour être plus compétitive sur le marché, Rosaline sollicite un premier prêt ensemble avec les autres membres de son groupe. Ce prêt leur permettra de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en:
This is a group made up of three people who live in the same neighborhood and of which the leader (the one with her hand raised in the photo) is named Rosaline. With the goal of increasing their working capital, this group is seeking a loan from ALIDé for the first time.

Rosaline is 35 years old and is married to a man named Maxime. The couple has five children, some of whom attend school and all of whom are in their care. Rosaline did not attend school. In order to meet her needs and those of her family, Rosaline sells liqueurs and charcoal. Rosaline gets her supplies in a market in Benin. To be more competitive in the marketplace, Rosaline is seeking a first loan with the other members of her group. This loan will allow them to increase their business and their income, and to expand their customer base.

loans.use: To purchase liqueurs and charcoal.

loans.name: Mitchelle

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Mitchelle works hard to support her family.

She buys and sells fish in the Philippines to earn a living. She earns additional income from a general store.

Mitchelle is seeking to borrow a loan in the amount of 20,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her business. She explains that she successfully paid back her two previous loans and is now requesting the additional loan to build her business. Mitchelle has been sustaining her business activities through 16 prior loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to continue to expand her business.

loans.use: to further expand her business by purchasing additional boxes of fish for re-sale

loans.name: Jose Rudys

texts.es:
José, solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar plywood, pegamento e insumos para la tienda, con lo que fortalecerá el negocio y equipara la carpintería, con lo que seguirá teniendo clientes más satisfechos.
Con la inversión anterior logro variar más los productos que ofrece en su tienda, aumento sus ventas, mejoro su economía con la que ha podido cancelar sus cuotas y cubrir los gastos familiares.
texts.en: Jose is asking for a new loan to buy plywood, glue, and supplies for the store.  He will use this to strengthen his business and to equip his carpentry shop thereby continuing to satisfy his customers. With the previous investment, he was able to offer a wider variety of products in his store, increase sales, and improve his financial situation. He has been able to make his loan payments and cover his household expenses.

loans.use: to buy plywood, glue, and supplies for the store.

loans.name: Mira

texts.en:
Mira works hard to support her family. She has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for nine years.

Mira requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional ingredients for her dishes, like spices, fish and vegetables.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her dishes, like spices, fish and vegetables.

loans.name: Monina

texts.en:
Monina is 61 years old and married. She has two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Monina has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for seven years.

She requested a PHP 29,500 loan amount through NWTF. She will use this amount to purchase additional ingredients for her dishes, like flour, sugar, and milk.

In the future, Monina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her dishes, like flour, sugar, and milk.

loans.name: Rapuncel

texts.en:
Rapuncel is 26 years old and married with two children who are in school. Rapuncel works very hard to provide for them.

Rapuncel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks like soap, chips, bread, eggs, canned goods, etc. Rapuncel has been in this business for seven years.

In the future, Rapuncel would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks like soap, chips, bread, eggs, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: As a married parent of nine children, Rebecca works hard to support her family. She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending. Rebecca is borrowing 5,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance for her motorcycle transport business. Rebecca has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Nueva Florecita Group

texts.en:
The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank group, “Nueva Florecita” meaning “New Little Flower,” is located in rural Chichicastenango, Guatemala. It is composed of thirteen motivated women who formed the group five years ago. As the ladies have excellent credit history, they are comfortable and excited to apply for a new loan cycle with Friendship Bridge. They will use their loans investing in their businesses, which mostly involve textile production.

Maria is the 23-year-old Secretary of the Trust Bank. Her fellow Trust Bank members chose her to occupy this position as she has had six years of education and has good Spanish reading and writing skills. Maria is the youngest member of the Trust Bank! She is a weaver and has requested a new loan which she will use to purchase various types of thread to produce more textiles. She will also use a small portion of the loan for her husband’s business. He sells cellphone accessories and parts. The couple works very hard each day so that they can meet the basic needs of their family including providing nutritious foods and education.

Maria, along with the other ladies in the Trust Bank, really appreciated the opportunities realized during their first loan cycle, and they are quite excited about this second loan cycle. Besides receiving and making payments on their loans, the women participate in monthly trainings on various topics like effective business administration, health and nutrition, and self-esteem. This month’s topic involves budgeting administration.

The ladies of the Trust Bank are so thankful to Kiva investors throughout the world who are helping them move ahead in their lives. They look forward to a brighter future as empowered women, creating better lives for themselves, their families, and their community of Chichicastenango.

loans.use: to purchase various types of thread to produce more textiles.

loans.name: Gulsaana

texts.ru: Гульсаане 55 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 5 детей. У Гульсааны - высшее образование, окончила педагогический институт, после окончания института вышла замуж за Рахмадилде. Супруг занимается частным строительством. А Гульсаана в данное время работает в местной школе преподавателем. Три дочери замужем, сын женат, проживает с родителями, младшая дочь-студентка. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Гульсаана занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 19 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Гульсааны, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 2 лошади, 2 бычка, 20 овец. Также Гульсаана со своей семьей обрабатывает 1,50 ГА поливной земли, где ежегодно сажает фасоль, картофель и получают хороший урожай. По хозяйству помогают все члены семьи, проживающие совместно. Ежемесячный доход составляет 13,000 сом (KGS) от реализации молока, от сезонных заработок супруга, от собственной зарплаты. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гульсаана обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку лошади для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Гульсаана планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Gulsaana is 55, married and has five children. Gulsaana has a college education and married Rakhmadild after she graduated from the Pedagogical Institute. Her spouse is an independent construction worker and she teaches at the local school. Three of her daughters and her son are married and live at home, and her youngest daughter is a student. In order to earn additional income for her family, Gulsaana raises livestock and plants crops. She started 19 years ago with a purchase of cattle for 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work, Gulsaana now has two dairy cows, two horses, two young bulls, 20 sheep, and 1.5 hectares of irrigated land where she plants beans and potatoes and gets a good harvest. She earns 13,000 som (KGS) per month from milk sales and her husband's seasonal income. With the goal of expanding her farm, Gulsaana asked the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan to buy a horse to increase her livestock numbers. She plans to use the profits to purchase additional domestic animals.

loans.use: to buy a horse

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en:
Rosalyn  is 31 years old, married with children, and a resident of Taboc Norte, Oroquieta City, Philippines. She earns a living through having her sari-sari (variety) store business where she generates her income to answer her family's needs.
