У Шаарбубу - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Шаарбубу занимается животноводством, стартовав 15 лет назад, с покупки скота на 6,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Шаарбубу, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 25 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 3,200 сом (KGS). Увеличение скота является увеличением дохода и благосостояния ее семьи, поэтому Шаарбубу обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку телят для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Шаарбубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить денежные средства на дальнейшее обучение сына, так как сын в следующем году заканчивает школу и намерен поступить в медицинский университет.
texts.en:
Shaarbubu is 48 years old, married, and has three children with her spouse. Her oldest daughter is a dentist, the second is a college student, and the boy is in 11th grade. Shaarbubu has a high school education. To provide the primary source of income for the family Shaarbubu raises livestock. She began 15 years ago with the purchase of 6,000 som (KGS) of animals. Thanks to her tireless work, she now owns three milk cows and twenty-five sheep. Her monthly income is 3,200 som (KGS). 

Expanding her herd increases her income and the wellbeing of the family, so Shaarbubu came to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan to buy calves. She plans to invest her earnings from use of the loan into further increasing the number of livestock she has, and she also plans to save for her son's continuing education, since he will graduate high school next year and intends to enter medical school.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Step Ahead Group

texts.en:
Givemore is the leader of Step Ahead group. He is 25 years old and married with one child, aged three. The child is not yet attending school. Givemore has a flea market business in Murehwa in Zimbabwe. He has been running this business for three years. He also earns income from vending, selling fruits and vegetables. He says that the main challenge to his business is liquidity.

Givemore requested this loan through MicroKing for Step Ahead group to purchase stocks for the festive season. He says that the extra income from this loan will help his business grow. In the future, he would like to open a shop.

loans.use: to buy clothes, handbags, shoes and blankets for resale.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia lives in Sanniquellie, the capital city of Nimba County, which is rich in natural resources. Living conditions are much better than in the capital city of Liberia and Nimba County is the second-most populated county in Liberia. 

Cynthia is 38 years old. She is a third grade dropout and she is single, with four children between the ages of 7 and 22 years. With little money from her susu (weekly saving accounts), she managed to establish her food business. She learned this trade from her mother. 

Cynthia is requesting a loan to purchase more oil, pepper, onions, salt, etc. for her business. Her plan is to one day own a shop.

loans.use: to purchase more oil, pepper, onions, salt, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Good Hope Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth managed to buy  fabric material for sewing clothes like trousers, skirts and shirts for resale. She says the loan had a positive impact on her business and it resulted in her boosting her business in terms of working capital as well as profits. Elizabeth also says the loan improved her family life greatly in terms of improved food diet as well as adequate school fees. She sees herself owning a clothing shop that will be well stocked.

Elizabeth has requested a loan of $750 to buy fabric material and wool for knitting jerseys. She is more than grateful to the fundraisers.

loans.use: to buy fabric material for clothes manufacturing and wool for knitting jerseys.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is a Cameroonian, age 31, married, with a child of two years. She has been in her secretarial business for over a year, which makes her experienced and stable. Her business is likely to succeed because it is located in an urban area with many potential customers. 

This loan will increase Jacqueline's turnover by 40 percent. Her standard of living will be improved, as well.

loans.use: to buy a complete computer.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is from the village of Calaocan. She is 50 years old and is married to Romeo, a father who is engaged in the farming business. The couple is thankful because they have been blessed with six children. Three of them are still attending school.

Evelyn has been engaged in the hog-raising business for almost seven years. She usually earns about PHP 7,000 per head. Since three of her children still attend school, Evelyn and her husband work hand in hand to cover all their household expenses.

With her aim to improve the hog raising business, she has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase feed and vaccine for daily maintenance of her hogs. She believes that through her requested loan she can further secure her family's future and improve her way of living.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vaccine for daily maintenance of her hogs

loans.name: Ben Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  membres du groupe BEN sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans, et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. 
Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygamiques à OUAYERMA I un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur 3ème prêt  dans ce groupe qui évolue avec   l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés.
Mme KADIA  qui occupe la prémière position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo,  fait le commerce de poissons dans ce groupe de femmes BEN. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt  55 kg de poissons (20kg de frais et 35 kg poissons fumés). Elle s’approvisionne à Sikasso.
Elle les revend à une place fixe au marché  et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30 000 fcfa dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The four members of the 'Ben' Group are all married women, with an average age of forty-one years, and an average of four children.  Most of them live in polygamous families in Ouayerma I, a busy district in the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali).

This will be the third loan for the group, who work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso, in order to satisfy the needs of their customers.  The previous loans have all been fully and correctly repaid.

Kadia (on the far right of the photo) sells fish.  She will use her loan to buy 55kg of fish (20kg of fresh fish, and 35kg of smoked fish).  She buys her supplies in Sikasso, and sells them from a fixed stall in the market, for cash, to both men and women.

Kadia expects to earn a monthly average of 30,000 francs CFA, and will use her earnings to repay her loan and interest, and save for the future.

loans.use: to buy fish for resale.

loans.name: Karina Lisseth

texts.es:
Karina, invertirá en la compra de cosméticos, lociones, cremas, gas propano, etc., para surtir la tienda, de esa forma fortalecerá su negocio de venta de gas propano y productos de bellez,para tener los ingresos que tanto necesita para cubrir los gastos familiares y cancelar las cuotas de la nueva deuda adquirida.
El crédito anterior le dio la oportunidad de mejorar sus ganancias con las cuales ha mejorado su economía y su vida familiar es mucho mejor. Hace dos meses nació un nuevo miembro de la familia la cual se encuentra en perfectas condiciones de salud.
texts.en: Karina will invest the loan to buy cosmetic products, lotions, creams, propane gas, etc. to stock her store. She will be able to increase her business of selling propane gas and beauty products.  Therefore, she will have the needed income to cover her household expenses and pay back her new debt. Her previous loan gave her the chance to improve her finances, and her family life is a lot better. Two months ago the family added a new member: a baby girl, who is in perfect health conditions.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products, lotions, creams, propane gas, etc.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en: Geraldine is married and the mother of one child who earns a living by buying and selling cosmetics to people in her village. She collects cash and installment-plan payments from her customers. She uses her motorcycle to do this, and recently took out a loan from GDMPC microcredit to buy more cosmetic products to sell. She will also use a portion of this loan for vehicle repairs and maintenance. She hopes someday to have a stall in the local market where she can do her business.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetic products to sell.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is married with two children and helps her husband on their farm to make a living. She also buys and sells charcoal in town and earns well from this. She had expanded their farm and needs money to finance the cost. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy seeds and fertilizer. She is hopeful to provide a better living for the family with their improved and greener farm.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Len's Group

texts.en:
A resident from a rural village of the Tbaung Khmum district, Len is a 33-year-old mother of two children. The main source of the family’s income is from rice farming; she has been in this business for several years. To supplement the family’s income, she also works as a paid worker. The current business earns her about 17,000KHR per day to support the family. 

Len is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to pay for labor fees in harvesting rice. She hopes to earn more crops so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to pay for labor fees in harvesting rice

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Zulaykho

texts.ru: Зулайхо мастерица и умелая швея. Ей 47 лет. Она замужем и живет со своей семьей в городе Душанбе. Зулайхо у себя  дома занимается швейным делом. Она по заказу шьет таджикские женские платья. Зулайхо начала работать швеей 6 лет тому назад и до сих пор продолжает свое дело. Она шьет на старой машинке, но сейчас просит кредит, чтобы купить новую модернизированную швейную машинку. На новой машинке Зулайхо будет шить быстрее и качественнее. А также будет делать на платьях красивые вышивки. Таким образом она сможет увеличить количество своих клиенток и естественно увеличить доход.
texts.en: Zulaykho is an excellent and skilled seamstress. She is 47 years old, married, and lives with her family in the city Dushanbe. She does her sewing at home, where she makes Tajik women's dresses to order. Zulaykho began working as a seamstress six years ago, and has continued up to this day. She uses an old sewing machine, but is asking for a loan to buy a new, modern one. A new machine would allow her to sew better and faster. It will also be able to do beautiful embroidery on the dresses. In this way she will be able to attract more clients and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Vosilahkon

texts.ru: Восилахон жизнерадостная женщина. Она молодая и целеустремленная женщина. Ей 23 года. Она вдова и на воспитании имеет 1 ребенка, которому 2 года. Восилахон после смерти мужа она стала единственной кормилицей своей семьи. Она более 5 лет занимается предоставлением услуги портнихи. Она предоставляет свои услуги дома. Восилахон имеет дополнительный доход от купли продажей сухофруктов. Она продает на местном рынке сухие абрикосы, сливу, а также миндаль. Восилахон хочет увеличить оборотный капитал и с такой целью она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки сухофруктов. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Vosilahkon is a cheerful woman. She is young and purposeful. She is 23 years old. She is a widow and has one child to raise, a two-year-old. Vosilahkon became the sole provider for her family after her husband died.  For more than five years she has been a dressmaker, working from home. She earns additional income by selling dried fruit. She sells dried apricots and prunes, as well as almonds, at a local market. Vosilahkon wants to increase her working capital, so she is asking for a loan of 5000 somoni to by dried fruit. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy dried fruits to increase working capital

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.ru: Гулчехра родилась в 1968 году. Она опытная портниха. Гулчехра более 18 лет занимается предоставлением услуги швеи. Она имеет свой швейный цех. Гулчехра имеет своих регулярных клиентов. Она старается предоставить свои услуги на высшем уровне. Она всегда в поиске новшества. Гулчехра замужем и имеет совершеннолетних детей. Ее муж трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации. Она хочет купить обогреватель для своего швейного цеха, но не имеет денег, а также ей необходимо купить новую швейную машинку. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 7500 сомони для покупки обогревателя и швейной машинки. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Gulchehra was born in 1968 and she is an experienced seamstress.  For more than 18 years, she has been working as a seamstress and she has her own sewing shop with regular clients.  She strives to give the highest level of service and she is always in search of new trends.  Gulchehra is married and has grown children.  Her husband is a migrant worker in the Russian Federation.  She wants to buy a heater for her sewing shop, but she does not have enough money.  She also needs to buy a new sewing machine.  She is asking for a loan of 7,500 somoni to buy a heater and a sewing machine.  She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and a heater for her workshop

loans.name: Comreds-A Group

texts.en:
Gasper, who is a businessman in his late 30s, is married and blessed with a child who is in school. 

Since 2001, Gasper has been running a bar business, selling beers, sodas, juices, and spirits. He is doing great with his business. He works from 6:00am to midnight daily and he is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be his second loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. With the previous loan, all of which has been successfully paid back, he bought stocks of beers, sodas, juices, and out-of-stock spirits for his business. Gasper used his business profit to cover school fees and home expenses. 

He will use this loan to buy beers, juices, sodas, and spirits to resell in his business. Gasper dreams to further improve his business. 

Gasper will share this loan with his loan group, Comreds-A Group, which consist of three members. The members of group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy beers, juices, sodas, and spirits to resell in his business.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a lady of 30 years, married to Joseph, and a mother of three children. She runs a retail shop and recently she started a charcoal-selling business. She has been in this business for three years now and she gets a monthly income of KES 20,000 (shillings).

This will be Grace's third loan with VisionFund Kenya. She plans to use the entire loan to buy charcoal to sell. In the future, Grace wants to improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
María, nuevamente se siente con la necesidad de solicitar un crédito para efectuar la compra de semilla de marañón por mayor ya que es el momento preciso debido a la temporada y tiene que mantener reservas para poder trabajar mientras llega la próxima cosecha.
Con el préstamo anterior logro tener más clientes, aumentar sus ventas y mejorar su economía, con lo que ha podido mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, ye vive en casa propia.
texts.en:
Maria Guadalupe feels the need to request another loan to buy cashew nuts wholesale, as this is the right season for them. She needs to increase her stock in order to be able to sell the cashew nuts until it is time for the next crop.

With her previous loan she was able to gain more clients, increase her sales and improve her savings, which has helped her improve her family's quality of life. Maria Guadalupe lives in her own home.

loans.use: to buy cashew nuts

loans.name: Hally

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Hally works hard to support her family. She runs a food vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buying and selling frozen foods. Hally has been sustaining her business activities with her previous loan from NWTF.

Hally is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta is a married woman, with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Marieta is 40 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Marieta has a food-vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase ingredients for her business, like rice, sugar, and coconuts.

Marieta has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her business, like rice, sugar, and coconuts.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Marilou requested a PHP 11,500 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional goods to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Marilou would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional goods to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell frozen foods business in the Philippines.

Rosalie requested a PHP 9,500 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more packs of frozen foods to sell.

Rosalie has been in this business for 20 years now. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more packs of frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Majani Ya Chai Group

texts.en:
Asha, who is in her mid 50's, is married with three children who all attend school. Asha has been running two businesses, a grocery business and selling cooked food. She has been in her businesses since 2004. Asha works from 8am to midnight and is able to make a good monthly profit.
 
From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is Asha's fourth loan. She used the previous loans to buy cafe ingredients like soft drinks, bites and grocery drinks. Asha has also improved on her grocery business by starting cooking foods. She has paid back all of her previous loans successfully. Asha used her business profits to cover school fees for her grandkids and food expenses for her family. She will use this loan to buy beers, sodas, water, rice, maize flour, cooking oil and beans. She dreams to own a wholesale drinks shop. 

Asha will share this loan with her loan group "MAJANI YA CHAI" which consist of 9 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy beers, sodas, water, rice, maize flour, cooking oil, and beans.

loans.name: Firuza

texts.en: Firuza is a kind, smart woman who lives in the northern part of Tajikistan. She is married, the mother of three children and began a livestock business 10 years ago with four sheep. Her business is successful but her income is still low. Her young son is ill and requires treatment but she does not have enough money to pay for it. She would like to send her oldest son to Russia to find a job because she needs his income to pay for the treatment. She is seeking a loan for 2,000 somoni to buy an airplane ticket to Russia. She is grateful for the support she receives.

loans.use: to buy airplane ticket to Russia for her son.

loans.name: Regie

texts.en:
Regie, who grows rice on his farmland, is 31 years old, married and has two children. He is thankful because his wife helps him in generating income to cover all of their basic needs.

To keep his farming business productive, Regie is requesting a loan of PHP10,000 to purchase 12 bags of fertilizers, two bags of pesticides and two bags of rice seeds. He is looking forward to approval of his request to help his business  improve.

loans.use: to purchase 12 bags of fertilizers, 2 bags of pesticides and 2 bags of rice seeds for his farming business

loans.name: María Eugenia

texts.es:
María es una mujer activa, emprendedora y dinámica; a sus 25 años de edad ya es propietaria de su microempresa, un taller de confección que inició hace 8 años como su primera experiencia laboral. Presta sus servicios a terceros y cuenta con el apoyo de una hermana; tiene un cliente fijo al que le confecciona billeteras, por lo que tiene trabajo constante durante todo el año; así logra generar recursos para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar.
Su propósito y proyecto para un futuro cercano es hacer crecer su negocio y confeccionar su propia línea de prendas para mejorar la rentabilidad de su actividad; por ello trabaja diariamente con empeño, constancia y disciplina.
Se motiva a solicitar el crédito con el fin de comprar una máquina plana que le permitirá fortalecer su capacidad instalada con la que mejorará las condiciones de trabajo y aumentará la producción, pues con ella facilitará y agilizará la labor, permitiéndole entregar los pedidos de manera oportuna y logrando aumentar los ingresos que percibe.
De esta forma, María seguirá avanzando para lograr los objetivos que se propone y así mejorar las condiciones de vida y el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
María is an active, enterprising and dynamic woman. At 25 years of age, she is already owner of a small business -- a tailoring shop that she started 8 years ago as her first work experience. She offers her services to third parties and counts on the support of her sister. She has one regular customer for whom she makes wallets, which is why she has constant work throughout the year.

Her aim and project for the near future is to grow her business and make her own line of clothing in order to increase the profitability of her business. That is why she works daily with determination, resolve and discipline.

She was inspired to apply for the loan in order to buy a tabletop sewing machine that will allow her to improve her production facilities, so that she can improve working conditions and improve her production. This will ease and speed up work, allowing her to deliver orders in an opportune fashion and increase the income that she receives.

In this way, María will continue moving forward to achieve her objectives and improve her family's living conditions and wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy a tabletop sewing machine.

loans.name: Maa Tarini Shg (H) Group

texts.en:
A portion of this group loan will go to support "Kabita". She is the president of "Maa Tarini SHG" self help group and is pictured here as the lady standing with her hand raised. Most of the women in her group are working in dairy farming or own other small businesses in their village in Odisha, a state on the eastern coast of India.

With her portion of the loan, Kabita will buy more cows to increase her dairy farming business. Her husband works as a florist in the village, and they both support their one child together. 

After this loan, Kabita will be able to be more independent and help give her family a better standard of living. Kabita is an entrepreneur at heart and has big dreams of one day owning a large dairy farm.

The women in the group also plan to save the money they earn from expanding their businesses to buy a food processing machine, which they can all use to make spices and pickle vegetables together.

loans.use: to purchase more cows to increase her dairy farming business.

loans.name: Sokna's Group

texts.en: Sokna lives in a rural village in the Sangke district of Cambodia. She is 40 years old, single and makes a living by farming rice. She has been in this business for five years, and earns about 15,000 KHR per day to support her needs. She has taken out and repaid four previous loans from VisionFund, and now leads a group which is applying for a new loan. She plans to use her portion of this loan to cover the cost of harvesting her rice and buying fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Sauda

texts.en:
Sauda is a single woman with no children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Sauda has operated a business selling clothing for the past two years. She sells  to town dwellers, passersby and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of inflation in her business. 

With the loan of 20,000 KES, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu in order to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Chrib's Group

texts.en:
Chrib is a mother of seven children, 47 years old and a borrower from Moung Russey district in Battambang province. Currently, two of her children are in school. To support her family, Chrib has been rice farming and working as a paid worker for 23 years. This business has returned her about 40,000 KHR per day. 

This is the fifth cycle for Chrib with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She successfully paid back her previous loan which has provided her family with a better living. Now she leads the group of three and the total requesting loan amount for her entire group is 3,600,000 KHR, of which 1,400,000 KHR is her loan portion. As the group leader, Chrib is going to use her loan portion to pay for a reaping fee. She hopes that she will collect her yield on time with good income.

loans.use: To pay for reaping fee.

loans.name: Sadia

texts.en:
Sadia is 28 years old, living with her spouse and child in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

She wants to have some savings so that she can provide better living quarters for her children, but it seems impossible in the absence of a profitable source of income.

Sadia's husband has been driving a motor rickshaw for several years; his income is insufficient to feed his entire family. He has to maintain the rickshaw’s body, but he does not have sufficient cash in hand to fix the problem. 

Therefore, Sadia requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so her husband would be able to buy the motor rickshaw’s body. She hopes that she would be able to make enough savings to meet the sudden needs of her family.

loans.use: pay for maintenance of her husband's rickshaw used for his business.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 26-year-old married father of one child. He is his family's sole breadwinner since his wife doesn't work.

Mohamad has worked in transportation for four years. His business is based on towing cars from one place to another for maintenance. His business is developing properly and gradually, but needs external support. He is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to register his business to expand his working zone as requested by the Lebanese government. This loan will help him in covering more regions and will allow him to increase his transporting machines requested for such business.

He hopes that in the future he can buy more towing trucks and that he will spread to cover almost all of the Lebanese territories, through opening small branches in the regions.

loans.use: to register his business to expand his working zone as requested by the Lebanese government.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is a 40-year-old single lady, who  is the sole breadwinner for three members of her family.
Lina is a hardworking woman who has been selling clothes for 13 years to make sure that she can cover her own and her family’s needs.
Lina is acquiring a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with a special Christmas and winter collection. This will increase her income and develop her standard of living.
Lina’s business is mobile and she doesn’t have a shop of her own. Her future plans will be concentrated on developing her business through opening her own stable clothing shop.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with a special Christmas and winter collection which will increase her income and develop her living standards.

loans.name: Leon

texts.es:
León nació en la ciudad de Pilco – Grande y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, él tiene 55  años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre. 

León se siente alegre por el apoyo brindado y por el préstamo porque le ayudo a incrementar el capital del negocio,  él continua trabajando en su pequeña carpintería y en sus horas libres trabaja para una entidad del estado, él en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar madera y otros materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo clavos, pintura y otras cosas más.

(La comunidad de Pilco – Grande está ubicado en el distrito de Huayllabamba dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo en el  departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
León was born in the city of Pilco - Grande and still lives there. He is 55 years old and in a common law relationship.

León is happy with the assistance he received. His previous loan was helpful because it helped to increase his business capital. He continues to work in his small carpentry shop and in his free time he works for a state entity. León is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to buy wood and other materials for his work such as nails, paint, and additional items.

The community of Pilco - Grande is located in the District of Huayllabamba, which is in Paucartambo Province in the Department of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy wood, nails, paint, and other items for his carpentry shop.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es: La señora Rosalía tiene 42 años, ella sigue con la misma actividad del tejido de chompas y mantas de Alpaca para la mujeres, tiene su taller y domicilio en la localidad de Batallas, este crédito es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la  señora Rosalía va a usar este préstamo para la compra de lana de alpaca por mayor para el tejido de sus chompas y mantas ya que por esta fechas de fin de año que se acerca la navidad  tiene mucha venta también entrega pedidos a los distintos mercados de la ciudad de La Paz y el Alto, se siente feliz y agradecida con los prestamistas de Kiva por la oportunidad que le dan para crecer en su negocio, utilizara los beneficios en la compra de un motor para su movilidad ya que esta teniendo algunas fallas y este es su medio de transporte que le ayuda a dejar sus pedidos.
texts.en:
Rosalía is 42 years old and makes a living in knitting Alpaca wool sweaters and blankets for women. Her home and her studio are located in Batallas. 

This is her first loan cycle with this institution. Rosalía will use the loan to buy Alpaca wool wholesale so she can knit sweaters and blankets, since she has a lot of orders and deliveries to markets in La Paz and Alto around Christmas time and the end of the year.

She is happy and thankful for the opportunity Kiva lenders are giving her to grow her business. She will use the profits to buy a new motor for her vehicle, because the current one has been failing and she relies on this vehicle to deliver her orders.

loans.use: to buy wool

loans.name: Roziya

texts.en: Roziya is 38 years old. She is married and has four children. Her husband passed away some years ago, so she is her family's sole breadwinner. Her goal is to comfort her children with a good life and all the modern conveniences. Fast developments in the modern world have made her children more progressive. She tries to provide them with a better quality of life, which is why 20 years ago she began her own business of sewing national women dresses. Thanks to the good service she provides, she has managed to gain many customers and improve her family's quality of life. She wants to develop her business further but to do this she needs to buy fabrics. She is asking for a loan of 2,000 Somoni to buy the supplies she needs and thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy fabrics

loans.name: Harun

texts.en:
For the last 18 months, Harun has been running his business in Olkalou. He is a shopkeeper and sells items like sugar, sweets, maize flour and cooking fat.  He has applied for his first loan of KES 20,000 from VisionFund Kenya to enable him replenish stock in his shop.

His monthly income from his business is KES 7,000 and he intends to use the profits anticipated from his expanded business to educate his children, pay his loan back to VisionFund Kenya, and to expand his business further.

Harun is 37 years old, married to Beatrice, and they are blessed with three children, aged five years, three years and three months old.  He hopes to have a prosperous future in business and family

loans.use: To buy more sugar, maize flour, sweets and cooking fat to sell to his customers at the shop

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline is a 37-year-old married woman. She has 2 children, ages 8 years and 14. She describes herself as a focused woman . She operates a beauty salon where she provides hair services and sells hair oil. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy a water storage container . Her business goal is to expand her business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will start a tea farming business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to purchase a water storage container.

loans.name: Geronica

texts.en:
Geronica works hard to support her family. Geronica is married and has a business buying and selling fruit in the Philippines.

Geronica requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fruit to sell. She has been in this business for four years now.

Geronica would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit to sell

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Lanie is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.  She works hard to support her family. 

Lanie requested a loan of PHP 9,500 through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell.  Lanie has been in this business for 4 years now.

In the future, Lanie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy and sell kitchen cookware and appliances business in the Philippines.

Teresita requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy more kitchen products to sell.

She has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money to be able to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more kitchen cookware and appliances to sell.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is 60 years old and is married with four children.

She earns a living by running a pig fattening farm in the Philippines. Felicidad is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Felicidad has been in pig farming for 3 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Arquella

texts.en:
Arquella is 38 years old and married, with four children. With two children currently in school, Arquella works very hard to provide for them.

Arquella runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more items to sell, like bread, canned goods, soft drinks, and other groceries.

Arquella has been in this business for five years and she sells a variety of items, such as bread, canned goods, soft drinks, and other groceries. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell, like bread, canned goods, soft drinks, and other groceries.

loans.name: Geronima

texts.en: As the married parent of five children, Geronima works hard to support her family. She does this by running an ice cream-making business in the Philippines, and supplements the income she earns there by selling fish. Geronima has requested a loan for PHP 29,500 from NWTF to buy ingredients to use when making ice cream. She has sustained her business activities over the last few years with 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her ice cream-making business

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine and her family live in Kapan city. She has two daughters, who are already married and live with their families, and a son who lives with them. Karine has a specialty of nursing, but she has never worked. It has been many years now that she has been engaged in the clothes-trading business. She rents a stall in Kapan where she sells women's and men's clothes, underwear, shoes and boots, as well as children's clothes and shoes. 
She buys all her stall merchandise from the Yerevan wholesale market every month. She is sure that this loan, like her previous loan from Kiva, will bring success, good income and a lot of customers. 
Karine asks a loan of 1.100.000 Armenian drams in order to buy a winter clothing collection.

loans.use: to buy a winter clothing collection in order to make a good profit from Christmas and New Year sales.
